texto: an International Standard requires approval by at least 75 % of the member bodies casting a vote. Attention is drawn to the possibility that some of the elements of this document may be the subject of patent rights. ISO shall not be held responsible for identifying any or all such patent rights. ISO 10014 was prepared by Technical Committee ISO/TC 176, Quality management and quality assurance, Subcommittee SC 3, Supporting technologies. This first edition of ISO 10014 cancels and replaces ISO/TR 10014:1998, which has been technically revised. The intent of this edition is to improve the relationship of ISO 10014 with the ISO 9000 series of International Standards and to include a new
